definition: to appear vividly on paper (idiom); to show forth vividly (in writing, painting etc)/to stand out markedly
to jump/to leap
correct/right/so/thus/like this/-ly
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc
variant of 紙|纸[zhi3]
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]

sentences.english: Though it is shorter than I hope, the love to our Motherland is vividly displayed on the paper.
sentences.chinese: 尽管短了一些，但是其中对祖国热爱之情跃然纸上。

sentences.english: As they watch the ladies, they scribble on paper.
sentences.chinese: 在看客的观赏间，美丽的女士跃然纸上。

definition: to show forth/to appear as a vivid image/to stand out markedly
the wording and purport of what one writes
to trace over/to take a copy (of a calligraphy, a painting etc)/(fig.) to describe/to portray
to finish (a letter, a painting) at a stroke
vivid/lively
vivid and lifelike (idiom); true to life/realistic
to describe/to portray
living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
to write elegantly
brush stroke in Chinese painting and calligraphy/brushwork/style of drawing or writing
line drawing in traditional ink and brush style/simple and straightforward style of writing
implicit/restrained/to be imbued with
to put pen to paper/pen mark
spirit/mood/(linguistics) modal
(of writing) tone/style
to describe/to depict/to portray/description
